title: `spack compilers` gets compiler version from PrgEnv version rather than compiler

labels.name: triage
labels.description: The issue needs to be prioritized

body:
<!-- Explain, in a clear and concise way, the command you ran and the result you were trying to achieve.
Example: "I ran `spack find` to list all the installed packages and ..." -->

### Steps to reproduce the issue

```console
$ ./bin/spack compilers
==> Available compilers
-- aocc sles15-any ----------------------------------------------
aocc@8.0.0  aocc@2.2.0.1  aocc@2.2.0.1

-- cce sles15-any -----------------------------------------------
cce@11.0.4

-- gcc sles15-any -----------------------------------------------
gcc@10.2.0  gcc@10.2.0  gcc@9.3.0  gcc@9.3.0  gcc@8.1.0

-- intel sles15-any ---------------------------------------------
intel@19.1.3.304  intel@19.1.3.304  intel@8.0.0
$ cat ~/.spack/cray/compilers.yaml
[...]
- compiler:
    spec: intel@8.0.0
    paths:
      cc: cc
      cxx: CC
      f77: ftn
      fc: ftn
    flags: {}
    operating_system: sles15
    target: any
    modules:
    - PrgEnv-intel
    - intel/8.0.0
    environment: {}
    extra_rpaths: []
- compiler:
    spec: intel@19.1.3.304
    paths:
      cc: cc
      cxx: CC
      f77: ftn
      fc: ftn
    flags: {}
    operating_system: sles15
    target: any
    modules:
    - PrgEnv-intel
    - intel/19.1.3.304
    environment: {}
    extra_rpaths: []
- compiler:
    spec: intel@19.1.3.304
    paths:
      cc: cc
      cxx: CC
      f77: ftn
      fc: ftn
    flags: {}
    operating_system: sles15
    target: any
    modules:
    - PrgEnv-intel
    - intel/19.1.3.304
    environment: {}
    extra_rpaths: []
```

the module `intel/8.0.0` does not exist:

```
$  module avail
[...]
   PrgEnv-intel/8.0.0 (L)    cray-libsci/21.04.1.1 (L)    intel/19.1.3.304       (L,D)
   aocc/2.2.0.1       (D)    cray-pmi-lib/6.0.10          iobuf/2.0.10
   atp/3.13.1                cray-pmi/6.0.10              papi/6.0.0.6
   cce/11.0.4                cray-python/3.8.5.0          perftools-base/21.02.0 (L)
   cpe/21.04                 cray-stat/4.10.1             valgrind4hpc/2.11.1
   cray-R/4.0.3.0     (D)    craype/2.7.6          (L)
   cray-ccdb/4.11.1          craypkg-gen/1.3.14

--------------------------- /opt/cray/pe/lmod/modulefiles/craype-targets/default ----------------------------
   craype-accel-amd-gfx908    craype-hugepages16M     craype-hugepages32M     craype-network-none
   craype-accel-host          craype-hugepages1G      craype-hugepages4M      craype-network-ofi  (L)
   craype-accel-nvidia70      craype-hugepages256M    craype-hugepages512M    craype-network-ucx
   craype-accel-nvidia80      craype-hugepages2G      craype-hugepages64M     craype-x86-milan
   craype-hugepages128M       craype-hugepages2M      craype-hugepages8M      craype-x86-rome     (L)

------------------------------------------- /opt/cray/modulefiles -------------------------------------------
   cray-lustre-client/2.12.4.2_cray_18_g0120bae-7.0.1.0_2.17__g0120bae110.shasta
   cray-shasta-mlnx-firmware/1.0.8
   cray-ucx/2.7.0-1
   dvs/2.12_4.0.102-7.0.1.0_8.1__g30d29e7a
   libfabric/1.11.0.4.67                                                         (L)
   xpmem/2.2.40-7.0.1.0_1.9__g1d7a24d.shasta                                     (L)

--------------------------------------------- /opt/modulefiles ----------------------------------------------
   aocc/2.2.0.1      darshan/3.2.1    gcc/9.3.0     intel/19.1.3.304
   cray-R/4.0.3.0    gcc/8.1.0        gcc/10.2.0
```

My guess is that this goes unnoticed because a) for most compilers the compiler version is bigger than the PrgEnv version (except for aocc where this gets annoying) and b) because loading modules gets ignored (see #21253) amd loading a PrgEnv pulls in the compiler module automatically.

### Information on your system

HPE Cray EX "Alps (Eiger)" at CSCS.
